abstract: European Commission releases proposed rules that will require world's largest companies to disclose more information about offshore tax havens and about how they are taxed by governments of European Union member states; rules were amended and released early in response to leak of documents from Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca.

headline.print_headline: On the Hunt for Havens, E.U. Calls for Tax Data
headline.main: European Union Calls for Big Companies to Disclose More Tax Data

snippet: The proposed rules, in the works before the Panama Papers leak, are intended in some ways to lift the veil on similar types of corporate secrets.
lead_paragraph: The proposed rules, in the works before the Panama Papers leak, are intended in some ways to lift the veil on similar types of corporate secrets.
